El programa ping es una herramienta de diagn√≥stico de redes utilizada para verificar la conectividad y la latencia entre dos dispositivos.¬†
En esencia, ping env√≠a un paquete de datos a un dispositivo de destino y mide el tiempo que tarda en recibir la respuesta.¬†Este tiempo, medido en milisegundos, se conoce como latencia o ping, y sirve para evaluar la calidad de la conexi√≥n.

El dispositivo de destino, si est√° en l√≠nea, responde con un paquete de eco ICMP.

Adem√°s, ping puede indicar si hay p√©rdida de paquetes, lo que significa que algunos paquetes no llegaron a su destino.

¬øPara qu√© se usa?

English
The ping program is a network diagnostic tool used to verify connectivity and latency between two devices.
In essence, ping sends a data packet to a target device and measures the time it takes to receive the response. This time, measured in milliseconds, is known as latency or ping, and is used to assess the quality of the connection.
How does it work?

The ping command sends an ICMP (Internet Control Message Protocol) packet to the destination device.
The target device, if it is online, responds with an ICMP echo packet.
The ping tool measures the time it takes for the response to arrive and displays it as ‚Äúround-trip time‚Äù (RTT) in milliseconds.
In addition, ping can indicate if there is packet loss, which means that some packets did not reach their destination.

What is it used for?

Verify connectivity: Ensure that a device is connected and responding on the network.
Measure latency: Determine the quality of the connection, especially in online gaming and video conferencing.
Diagnose network problems: Identify connectivity problems, packet loss or high latency.

In short, ping is an essential tool to diagnose and evaluate the quality of the network connection between two devices.

DHCP, or Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol, is a network protocol that allows devices to automatically obtain network configuration information, such as IP addresses, without manual intervention by the user or network administrator.

It is primarily used for remote system administration and secure file transfer. In essence, SSH creates an encrypted ‚Äútunnel‚Äù between two computers, allowing protected communication of data, passwords and other sensitive information (taken from [cloudflare.com](translate.google.com/translate://www.cloudflare.com/learning/access-management/what-is-ssh/&hl=es&sl=en&tl=es&client=sge#:~:text=SSH (Secure Shell)%20es%20un,trav%C3%A9s%20de%20redes%20no%20seguras.)).

¬øQu√© es?

Conecta el adaptador de corriente: Conecta el adaptador de corriente USB al enchufe de pared y luego conecta el cable USB correspondiente al puerto de la Raspberry Pi.¬†

Cargadores de tel√©fono: Aunque algunos cargadores de tel√©fono pueden funcionar, es recomendable usar un adaptador de corriente dise√±ado espec√≠ficamente para la Raspberry Pi para asegurar un rendimiento √≥ptimo y evitar problemas de alimentaci√≥n.

What is Raspberry Pi?
A Raspberry Pi is a computer the size of a credit card that you can configure to your needs.

To charge a Raspberry Pi, you need to connect it to a power supply.
The most common way is through a USB to microUSB or USB-C cable, depending on the model, connected to a USB power adapter. Make sure that the adapter provides the right voltage and current for your Raspberry Pi model.

English
The 2G (Second Generation) network is the mobile technology that marked the transition from analog to digital, making possible encrypted voice calls and text messages (SMS). It is used for basic voice and text communications, in addition to supporting some limited data services such as e-mail and low-speed Internet access. It was fundamental to the global expansion of mobile telephony and the basis for later technologies, although its data rate is low.
What is the 2G network?

Digitalization of communications: 2G was the first generation to adopt digital technology for mobile communications, replacing previous analog systems.
GSM Technology: It is based on the Global System for Mobile Communications (GSM).
Main services: Its main function is the voice call service and the sending and receiving of text messages (SMS).

What is it used for?

Voice calls: It made it possible to make encrypted voice calls with better quality than in the analog generation.
SMS messaging: It made it possible to send and receive text messages, which revolutionized the way of communicating.
Limited data services: With the introduction of services such as GPRS (General Packet Radio Service), it opened the door to basic data services, allowing very limited access to the Internet and e-mail.
Coverage: This is important because it provides good coverage in rural or mountainous areas where more advanced networks have not yet reached.
IoT (Internet of Things) devices: Still used in some machine-to-machine (M2M) communication devices and GPS tracking devices.

Its legacy and future

Foundation for the future: 2G laid the groundwork for more advanced technologies such as 3G and 4G by demonstrating the efficiency of the digital system.
Gradual shutdown: Due to its slow data speed compared to newer generations, most operators are shutting down and replacing 2G networks to reallocate those frequencies to more efficient technologies such as 4G and 5G.

Un servidor es un tipo de ordenador o sistema inform√°tico dise√±ado para proporcionar servicios, recursos o informaci√≥n a otros dispositivos o usuarios a trav√©s de una red.¬†
Funciona como un intermediario que procesa solicitudes y las env√≠a a otros equipos, o a usuarios individuales.¬†Estos servicios pueden incluir el almacenamiento de archivos, la gesti√≥n de bases de datos, el alojamiento de sitios web, entre otros.
En esencia, un servidor es un ordenador potente que est√° dise√±ado para manejar grandes cantidades de datos y realizar tareas complejas de manera eficiente para m√∫ltiples usuarios simult√°neamente.¬†
Algunos ejemplos comunes de servidores incluyen:

Servidores web:¬†Almacenan y sirven p√°ginas web.
Servidores de correo:¬†Gestionan el env√≠o y recepci√≥n de mensajes de correo electr√≥nico.
Servidores de bases de datos:¬†Almacenan y gestionan grandes conjuntos de datos.
Servidores de archivos:¬†Permiten el almacenamiento y acceso compartido a archivos.
Servidores de aplicaciones:¬†Ejecutan aplicaciones para varios usuarios.

De acuerdo con la finalidad, podemos clasificarlos en:

Servidores de pruebas: Un servidor de pruebas, tambi√©n conocido como servidor de staging o pre-producci√≥n,¬†es un entorno independiente utilizado para probar y validar aplicaciones o sitios web antes de su despliegue en un servidor de producci√≥n¬†(el que usan los usuarios finales).¬†La diferencia clave radica en su prop√≥sito: el servidor de pruebas se utiliza para pruebas exhaustivas, mientras que el servidor de producci√≥n es para el uso real.
Servidor de Producci√≥n: tiene como finalidad Servir aplicaciones y sitios web a los usuarios finales, quienes interact√∫an con la aplicaci√≥n o sitio web. Contiene los datos reales de los usuarios y la aplicaci√≥n en funcionamiento. Es abierto al p√∫blico o a un grupo espec√≠fico de usuarios.

Los servidores son una parte fundamental de la infraestructura de internet y de las redes empresariales, ya que permiten la comunicaci√≥n y el intercambio de informaci√≥n entre diferentes dispositivos y usuarios.
English
A server is a type of computer or computer system designed to provide services, resources or information to other devices or users over a network.
It functions as an intermediary that processes requests and sends them to other computers, or to individual users. These services may include file storage, database management, website hosting, among others.
In essence, a server is a powerful computer that is designed to handle large amounts of data and perform complex tasks efficiently for multiple users simultaneously.
Some common examples of servers include:

Web servers: They store and serve web pages.
Mail servers: They manage the sending and receiving of e-mail messages.
Database servers: Store and manage large data sets.
File servers: Allow storage and shared access to files.
Application servers: Run applications for multiple users.

According to the purpose, we can classify them into:

Test servers: A test server, also known as a staging or pre-production server, is a standalone environment used to test and validate applications or websites prior to their deployment on a production server (the one used by end users). The key difference lies in their purpose: the test server is used for extensive testing, while the production server is for actual use.
Production Server: itspurpose is to serve applications and websites to end users, who interact with the application or website. It contains the actual data of the users and the running application. It is open to the public or to a specific group of users.

Servers are a fundamental part of the Internet infrastructure and enterprise networks, as they enable communication and information exchange between different devices and users.

In the context of Windows, CMD, or Command Prompt, is a command line interface that allows you to interact with the operating system using text commands.

Troubleshooting tool: CMD allows you to run commands to diagnose and fix system problems, such as network errors or configuration problems.
Scripting base: CMD is the basis for creating and executing scripts, allowing you to automate repetitive and complex tasks.

In summary, CMD is an essential tool for managing and administering Windows systems, providing a powerful and flexible way to interact with the operating system using text commands.

Entendemos por¬†sistema inform√°tico¬†el¬†conjunto de elementos f√≠sicos y l√≥gicos que se encargan de recibir, guardar y procesar datos para luego entregarlos en forma de resultados. El esquema de un sistema inform√°tico engloba todo aquello que contiene una parte tangible (hardware) y otra l√≥gica (software).
En la¬†actualidad, los SI¬†ocupan un lugar clave para la organizaci√≥n humana, ya que resulta ser una herramienta poderosa para el intercambio de informaci√≥n y la elaboraci√≥n de redes inform√°ticas que superan la barrera de las distancias.
Componentes¬†de un sistema inform√°tico
Los elementos que forman la¬†estructura b√°sica¬†de todo sistema inform√°tico son:

Hardware:¬†recoge todas las partes f√≠sicas del SI, es decir, todo lo que se puede tocar. En el caso de un ordenador, estos elementos del sistema inform√°tico ser√≠an: la pantalla, el teclado o el rat√≥n.
Software:¬†se refiere a la parte l√≥gica de todo sistema inform√°tico, lo intangible. Es el conjunto de programas incluyendo datos, instrucciones, aplicaciones, etc, que permiten al usuario comunicarse con el hardware para poder realizar diversas tareas.
Personal inform√°tico:¬†toda persona que utiliza de alguna manera el sistema, entre ellos, los creadores de software, los programadores o los usuarios en general.

Caracter√≠sticas de un sistema inform√°tico
Algunas¬†caracter√≠sticas¬†que definen a un SI son:

Los sistemas inform√°ticos est√°n¬†dise√±ados para procesar, almacenar, obtener y recibir informaci√≥n.
Proporcionan una interfaz amigable¬†para su uso y gesti√≥n por parte de las personas.
Facilitan la automatizaci√≥n de los procesos, ya que la programaci√≥n de un sistema inform√°tico est√° dirigida a realizar tareas de forma aut√≥noma.
Su¬†objetivo¬†primordial es¬†ofrecer nuevas y mejores condiciones de vida¬†a los seres humanos.

Clasificaci√≥n de los sistemas inform√°ticos
Los sistemas inform√°ticos pueden clasificarse seg√∫n su:

Volumen de procesamiento:¬†dependiendo de la capacidad que tienen para procesar y gestionar los datos.
Utilizaci√≥n:¬†es decir, el uso que se le da al sistema inform√°tico, ya sea para cumplir tareas con criterio reducido o para manejar un mayor n√∫mero de variables.
Funci√≥n:¬†seg√∫n si es dise√±ado para cumplir prop√≥sitos puntuales dentro de una serie de trabajos. Podr√≠a estar programado para dar sugerencias en la toma de decisiones o para tomar una decisi√≥n propia a partir de datos recolectados.
Agrupamiento:¬†seg√∫n sean sistemas aislados o formen parte de redes de equipos interconectados en redes privadas, locales, amplias, etc√©tera.

Una vez que comprendamos qu√© son los sistemas inform√°ticos, pasamos a nombrar algunas¬†aplicaciones pr√°cticas, es decir,¬†para qu√© sirve un sistema inform√°tico en el mundo real. (Fuente: Universidad Isabel I)
English
A computer system is understood as the set of physical and logical elements that are responsible for receiving, storing and processing data and then delivering them in the form of results. The scheme of a computer system encompasses everything that contains a tangible part (hardware) and a logical part (software).
Nowadays, IS occupy a key place in human organization, as it is a powerful tool for the exchange of information and the development of computer networks that overcome the barrier of distances.
Components of a computer system
The elements that form the basic structure of any computer system are:

Hardware: this includes all the physical parts of the IS, i.e. everything that can be touched. In the case of a computer, these elements of the computer system would be: the screen, the keyboard or the mouse.
Software: refers to the logical part of any computer system, the intangible part. It is the set of programs including data, instructions, applications, etc., that allow the user to communicate with the hardware in order to perform various tasks.
Computer personnel: any person who uses the system in some way, including software developers, programmers or users in general.

Features of a computer system
Some characteristics that define an IS are:

Computer systems are designed to process, store, obtain and receive information.
They provide a friendly interface for its use and management by people.
They facilitate the automation of processes, since the programming of a computer system is aimed at performing tasks autonomously.
Their primary objective is to offer new and better living conditions to human beings.

Classification of computer systems
Computer systems can be classified according to their:

Processing volume: depending on the capacity they have to process and manage data.
Utilization: that is, the use given to the computer system, either to fulfill tasks with reduced criteria or to handle a greater number of variables.
Function: depending on whether it is designed to fulfill specific purposes within a series of jobs. It could be programmed to give suggestions for decision making or to make its own decision based on collected data.
Grouping: depending on whether they are isolated systems or are part of networks of equipment interconnected in private, local, wide networks, etcetera.

Once we understand what computer systems are, we will go on to name some practical applications, i.e., what a computer system is used for in the real world. (Source: Isabel I University)

es/_staging/sistema-operativo-so-operati.content:
Sistema operativo (SO) | Operating system (OS)
Fecha de creaci√≥n: 30 de agosto de 2025 23:19
Autor(a): Belen Sevilla Morillo

idioma: english, espa√±ol
Espa√±ol
Un sistema operativo (SO) es un software fundamental que act√∫a como intermediario entre el hardware de un dispositivo (como una computadora o tel√©fono) y las aplicaciones que utilizas.¬†
Gestiona los recursos del sistema, como la memoria, el procesador y los dispositivos de entrada/salida, y permite que las aplicaciones se ejecuten y funcionen correctamente.¬†Sin un SO, ser√≠a muy dif√≠cil o imposible usar un dispositivo inform√°tico.
Funciones principales de un sistema operativo:

Gesti√≥n de recursos: El SO administra la memoria RAM, el espacio de almacenamiento, el procesador, los dispositivos de entrada/salida (teclado, mouse, pantalla, etc.) y otros recursos del hardware.
Interfaz de usuario: Permite la interacci√≥n con el usuario a trav√©s de interfaces gr√°ficas (ventanas, iconos) o l√≠neas de comandos.
Ejecuci√≥n de aplicaciones: El SO carga y ejecuta las aplicaciones, proporcion√°ndoles los recursos necesarios y gestionando su interacci√≥n con el hardware.
Gesti√≥n de procesos: Organiza y controla la ejecuci√≥n de m√∫ltiples tareas o procesos de forma simult√°nea (multitarea).
Sistema de archivos: Organiza, almacena y recupera archivos en dispositivos de almacenamiento.
Seguridad: Controla el acceso a los recursos del sistema, protegi√©ndolo de accesos no autorizados.
Comunicaci√≥n en red: Permite la comunicaci√≥n entre dispositivos a trav√©s de redes, como Internet.

Ejemplos de sistemas operativos:

Para computadoras:¬†Windows, macOS, Linux.
Para dispositivos m√≥viles:¬†Android, iOS.

En resumen, un sistema operativo es esencial para que cualquier dispositivo inform√°tico funcione correctamente, permitiendo a los usuarios interactuar con el hardware y ejecutar aplicaciones de forma eficiente
English
An operating system (OS) is a fundamental piece of software that acts as an intermediary between the hardware of a device (such as a computer or phone) and the applications you use.
It manages system resources, such as memory, processor, and input/output devices, and allows applications to run and function properly. Without an OS, it would be very difficult or impossible to use a computing device.
Main functions of an operating system:

Resource management: the OS manages RAM, storage space, processor, input/output devices (keyboard, mouse, display, etc.) and other hardware resources.
User interface: Allows interaction with the user through graphical interfaces (windows, icons) or command lines.
Application execution: The OS loads and executes applications, providing them with the necessary resources and managing their interaction with the hardware.
Process management: Organizes and controls the execution of multiple tasks or processes simultaneously (multitasking).
File system: Organizes, stores and retrieves files on storage devices.
Security: Controls access to system resources, protecting it from unauthorized access.
Network communication: Enables communication between devices over networks, such as the Internet.

Examples of operating systems:

For computers: Windows, macOS, Linux.
For mobile devices: Android, iOS.

In short, an operating system is essential for any computing device to function properly, allowing users to interact with the hardware and run applications efficiently.

It means High-Speed Packet Access and is an enhancement technology for 3G mobile networks that increases the speed and efficiency of data transfer, both download (HSDPA) and upload (HSUPA).

In computing, a terminal or console is a device with which you connect to a computer, in more technical terms, it is a text-based user interface that allows you to interact with an operating system or application.

Difference between console and terminal: Although the terms are often used interchangeably, console can refer to the physical device, while terminal can refer to the software that emulates that device. es/_staging/umts-sistema-universal-de-te.content:
UMTS (Sistema Universal de Telecomuniaciones M√≥viles | UMTS (Universal Mobile Telecommunications System)
Fecha de creaci√≥n: 30 de agosto de 2025 23:19
Autor(a): Belen Sevilla Morillo

idioma: english, espa√±ol
Espa√±ol
UMTS (Sistema Universal de Telecomunicaciones M√≥viles) es una tecnolog√≠a de telefon√≠a m√≥vil de tercera generaci√≥n (3G) que proporciona acceso a internet de alta velocidad y servicios multimedia, sucesora del GSM (2G).¬†
Su principal prop√≥sito es ofrecer comunicaciones inal√°mbricas de banda ancha con mayores velocidades de descarga y carga que las redes anteriores, permitiendo la navegaci√≥n web, videollamadas y el uso de aplicaciones multimedia de forma m√°s eficiente.
(Fuente: [1NCE](www.1nce.com/es-es/recursos/iot-knowledge-base/que-significa-umts#:~:text=UMTS (Universal Mobile Telecommunications System)%20es%20una,por%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20de%20C%C3%B3digo%20de%20Banda%20Ancha))
¬øPara qu√© sirve UMTS?

**Acceso a Internet de banda ancha m√≥vil:**Permite conectar dispositivos a Internet a velocidades significativamente mayores que las de la generaci√≥n anterior (2G).
**Servicios multimedia:**Facilita la transmisi√≥n de datos de alta velocidad, lo que posibilita el uso de aplicaciones que requieren mucho ancho de banda, como la videollamada, la descarga de contenidos multimedia y la navegaci√≥n web fluida.
**Mayor calidad y capacidad:**Ofrece una calidad de comunicaci√≥n superior, similar a la de una red fija, y permite a m√°s usuarios conectarse simult√°neamente a la red.
**Evoluci√≥n hacia 4G/LTE:**Aunque es una tecnolog√≠a 3G, las sucesivas mejoras como el¬†HSPA¬†(High Speed Packet Access) y el¬†HSPA+¬†acercaron sus capacidades a las de las redes 4G (LTE), prolongando la vida √∫til de la infraestructura de red.
**Compatibilidad con dispositivos diversos:**Soporta una mayor variedad de terminales y aplicaciones, incluyendo los dispositivos del ¬´Internet de las Cosas¬ª (IoT) que requieren un uso intensivo de datos.

Caracter√≠sticas clave de UMTS


**Tecnolog√≠a CDMA:**Utiliza la tecnolog√≠a W-CDMA (Wideband Code Division Multiple Access) para transmitir datos a alta velocidad a trav√©s de una banda de radiofrecuencias m√°s amplia.


**Componentes de la red:**Incluye la Red de Acceso Terrestre (UTRAN), la Red Central (CN) y el Equipo de Usuario (UE).


Mejoras sobre GSM:
Ofrece velocidades de hasta 2 Mbps (inicialmente), con mejoras posteriores a trav√©s de HSPA y HSPA+ que alcanzan hasta 42 Mbps o m√°s, superando con creces las velocidades de las redes GSM


Referencias | References

English
UMTS (Universal Mobile Telecommunications System) is a third-generation (3G) mobile telephone technology that provides high-speed internet access and multimedia services, successor to GSM (2G).
Its main purpose is to offer broadband wireless communications with higher download and upload speeds than previous networks, allowing for web browsing, video calls, and the more efficient use of multimedia applications.
(Source: [1NCE](www.1nce.com/es-es/recursos/iot-knowledge-base/que-significa-umts#:~:text=UMTS (Universal Mobile Telecommunications System)%20es%20una,por%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20de%20C%C3%B3digo%20de%20Banda%20Ancha))
What is UMTS used for?

Mobile broadband Internet access: Allows devices to connect to the Internet at significantly higher speeds than the previous generation (2G).
Multimedia services: Facilitates high-speed data transmission, enabling the use of applications that require high bandwidth, such as video calls, multimedia content downloads, and smooth web browsing.
Higher quality and capacity: Offers superior communication quality, similar to that of a fixed network, and allows more users to connect to the network simultaneously.
Evolution towards 4G/LTE: Although it is a 3G technology, successive improvements such as HSPA (High Speed Packet Access) and HSPA+ brought its capabilities closer to those of 4G (LTE) networks, extending the useful life of the network infrastructure.
Compatibility with diverse devices: Supports a greater variety of terminals and applications, including Internet of Things (IoT) devices that require intensive data usage.

Key characteristics of UMTS

CDMA technology: Uses W-CDMA (Wideband Code Division Multiple Access) technology to transmit high-speed data through a wider radio frequency band.
Network components: Includes the Terrestrial Access Network (UTRAN), the Core Network (CN), and the User Equipment (UE).
Improvements over GSM: Offers speeds of up to 2 Mbps (initially), with later improvements through HSPA and HSPA+ reaching up to 42 Mbps or more, far exceeding the speeds of GSM networks.

WhatsApp is an instant messaging and calling application, owned by Meta, that allows users to send messages, make voice and video calls, and share files over the internet.
It is widely used for both personal and business communications.
It allows sending text, voice, video, voice and video messages, making voice and video calls, and sharing files such as photos, documents, locations and contacts.
Although it is mainly known for personal use to communicate with friends and family, it has a business version called **WhatsApp Business,** which allows you to interact with customers, manage sales and provide customer service.

Una conexi√≥n Wi-Fi es una tecnolog√≠a inal√°mbrica que permite a los dispositivos conectarse a una red, generalmente para acceder a Internet, sin necesidad de cables.¬†Funciona mediante ondas de radio, utilizando un router Wi-Fi para enviar y recibir datos entre dispositivos y la red.
M√°s detalladamente:

¬øQu√© es? Wi-Fi, o Wireless Fidelity, es una tecnolog√≠a que permite la comunicaci√≥n inal√°mbrica entre dispositivos y una red, generalmente utilizando ondas de radio.
¬øC√≥mo funciona? Un router Wi-Fi act√∫a como punto de acceso, recibiendo la se√±al de internet y transmiti√©ndola de forma inal√°mbrica a dispositivos como computadoras, tel√©fonos, tabletas, etc.
¬øPara qu√© sirve? Permite a los usuarios conectarse a internet y a otras redes sin necesidad de cables, facilitando la movilidad y el acceso a la informaci√≥n en diferentes lugares.
¬øQu√© dispositivos se pueden conectar? La mayor√≠a de los dispositivos electr√≥nicos modernos, como tel√©fonos inteligentes, computadoras port√°tiles, tabletas, televisores inteligentes, etc., pueden conectarse a una red Wi-Fi.
¬øEs lo mismo que Internet? No, Wi-Fi es la tecnolog√≠a que permite la conexi√≥n inal√°mbrica a una red, mientras que internet es una red global de redes de computadoras.
¬øQu√© necesitas para tener Wi-Fi? Necesitas un router Wi-Fi, que es el dispositivo que crea la red inal√°mbrica, y dispositivos con capacidad Wi-Fi para conectarse a ella.
¬øC√≥mo se configura? Generalmente, se accede a la configuraci√≥n Wi-Fi del dispositivo, se selecciona la red deseada y se ingresa la contrase√±a si es necesario.
¬øCu√°les son las ventajas? Permite la movilidad, elimina la necesidad de cables, facilita la conexi√≥n de m√∫ltiples dispositivos y ofrece mayor flexibilidad en la ubicaci√≥n de los dispositivos.

English
A Wi-Fi connection is a wireless technology that allows devices to connect to a network, usually to access the Internet, without the need for cables. It works via radio waves, using a Wi-Fi router to send and receive data between devices and the network.
In more detail:

What is Wi-Fi, or Wireless Fidelity, is a technology that enables wireless communication between devices and a network, generally using radio waves.
How does it work? A Wi-Fi router acts as an access point, receiving the internet signal and transmitting it wirelessly to devices such as computers, phones, tablets, etc.
What is it used for? It allows users to connect to the internet and other networks without the need for cables, facilitating mobility and access to information in different locations.
What devices can be connected? Most modern electronic devices, such as smartphones, laptops, tablets, smart TVs, etc., can connect to a Wi-Fi network.
Is it the same as the Internet? No, Wi-Fi is the technology that allows wireless connection to a network, while the internet is a global network of computer networks.
What do you need to have Wi-Fi? You need a Wi-Fi router, which is the device that creates the wireless network, and Wi-Fi capable devices to connect to it.
How do you set it up? Generally, you access the device‚Äôs Wi-Fi settings, select the desired network and enter the password if necessary.
What are the advantages? It enables mobility, eliminates the need for cables, makes it easier to connect multiple devices, and offers greater flexibility in device placement.

es/glossary/conc-2g-net.title: Red 2G | 2G Net
es/glossary/conc-2g-net.content:
La red 2G (Segunda Generaci√≥n) es la tecnolog√≠a m√≥vil que marc√≥ la transici√≥n de lo anal√≥gico a lo digital, haciendo posible las llamadas de voz encriptadas y los mensajes de texto (SMS).¬†Sirve para comunicaciones b√°sicas de voz y texto, adem√°s de dar soporte a algunos servicios de datos limitados como el correo electr√≥nico y acceso a internet a baja velocidad.¬†Fue fundamental para la expansi√≥n global de la telefon√≠a m√≥vil y la base para tecnolog√≠as posteriores, aunque su velocidad de datos es baja.
¬øQu√© es la red 2G?

Tecnolog√≠a GSM:¬†Se basa en el Sistema Global para Comunicaciones M√≥viles (GSM).

¬øPara qu√© sirve?

Llamadas de voz: Permiti√≥ realizar llamadas de voz cifradas y con mejor calidad que en la generaci√≥n anal√≥gica.
Mensajer√≠a SMS: Hizo posible enviar y recibir mensajes de texto, lo que revolucion√≥ la forma de comunicarse.
Servicios de datos limitados: Con la introducci√≥n de servicios como el GPRS (Servicio General de Paquetes por Radio), abri√≥ la puerta a servicios de datos b√°sicos, permitiendo el acceso a internet de forma muy limitada y al correo electr√≥nico.
Cobertura: Es importante porque proporciona una buena cobertura en zonas rurales o monta√±osas donde las redes m√°s avanzadas a√∫n no han llegado.
Dispositivos IoT (el Internet de las cosas - Internet of Things): Sigue utiliz√°ndose en algunos dispositivos de la comunicaci√≥n de m√°quina a m√°quina (M2M) y en dispositivos de rastreo GPS.

Su legado y futuro

Base para el futuro: La 2G sent√≥ las bases para tecnolog√≠as m√°s avanzadas como el 3G y el 4G al demostrar la eficiencia del sistema digital.
Apagado gradual: Debido a su baja velocidad de datos en comparaci√≥n con las generaciones m√°s nuevas, la mayor√≠a de los operadores est√°n apagando y reemplazando las redes 2G para reasignar esas frecuencias a tecnolog√≠as m√°s eficientes como el 4G y 5G

English
The 2G (Second Generation) network is the mobile technology that marked the transition from analog to digital, making possible encrypted voice calls and text messages (SMS). It is used for basic voice and text communications, in addition to supporting some limited data services such as e-mail and low-speed Internet access. It was fundamental to the global expansion of mobile telephony and the basis for later technologies, although its data rate is low.
What is the 2G network?

Digitalization of communications: 2G was the first generation to adopt digital technology for mobile communications, replacing previous analog systems.
GSM Technology: It is based on the Global System for Mobile Communications (GSM).
Main services: Its main function is the voice call service and the sending and receiving of text messages (SMS).

What is it used for?

Voice calls: It made it possible to make encrypted voice calls with better quality than in the analog generation.
SMS messaging: It made it possible to send and receive text messages, which revolutionized the way of communicating.
Limited data services: With the introduction of services such as GPRS (General Packet Radio Service), it opened the door to basic data services, allowing very limited access to the Internet and e-mail.
Coverage: This is important because it provides good coverage in rural or mountainous areas where more advanced networks have not yet reached.
IoT (Internet of Things) devices: Still used in some machine-to-machine (M2M) communication devices and GPS tracking devices.

Its legacy and future

Foundation for the future: 2G laid the groundwork for more advanced technologies such as 3G and 4G by demonstrating the efficiency of the digital system.
Gradual shutdown: Due to its slow data speed compared to newer generations, most operators are shutting down and replacing 2G networks to reallocate those frequencies to more efficient technologies such as 4G and 5G.

es/glossary/conc-domain-name.title: Nombre de dominio | Domain name
es/glossary/conc-domain-name.content:

Es como la direcci√≥n postal de un sitio web, pero en lugar de n√∫meros, utiliza texto.¬†Por ejemplo, ‚Äúsolecolombia.org‚Äù es un nombre de dominio.¬†Permite que los usuarios accedan a sitios web y servicios sin tener que recordar complejas direcciones IP num√©ricas. (Fuente:Google Help)

Aqu√≠ hay algunos puntos clave sobre los nombres de dominio:

English
A domain name is a unique, easy-to-remember address used to access a website or service on the Internet.

In more technical terms, a domain name is a way of translating a numeric IP address (such as 192.0.2.1) into a text string that is easy to remember and easy to type, such as ‚Äúexample.com‚Äù. This translation process is performed by the Domain Name System (DNS), which is a directory that associates domain names with their corresponding IP addresses.
Here are some key points about domain names:

Ease of use: domain names make it much easier for people to find and access websites, as they are easier to remember and type than IP addresses.

Components of a domain: A domain name typically consists of two main parts: the name (e.g., ‚Äúsolecolombia‚Äù) and the extension or top-level domain (e.g., ‚Äú.org‚Äù).

A domain name is an essential tool for internet navigation, allowing users to access websites and services easily and efficiently, and also serves as the identity of a website on the web.

English
The EDGE connection, related to  (Mobile Telephony Technology), refers to the mobile technology ‚ÄúEnhanced Data rates for GSM of Evolution‚Äù (EDGE), a 2G network that acts as a bridge to 3G to provide basic internet, or to the concept of ‚ÄúEdge Computing‚Äù, a method of processing data close to its origin to streamline high-speed applications and services on connected devices, such as the Internet of Things (IoT).

es/glossary/conc-ethernet.title: Conexi√≥n/ cable Ethernet | Ethernet cable/ connection
es/glossary/conc-ethernet.content:
Una conexi√≥n Ethernet es una tecnolog√≠a que permite conectar dispositivos electr√≥nicos a una red local (LAN) o a una red de √°rea amplia (WAN) mediante un cable. Su funci√≥n principal es la transmisi√≥n de datos entre dispositivos, ya sea para compartir informaci√≥n o para conectarse a internet.
M√°s detalladamente:

Ethernet ofrece velocidades m√°s r√°pidas y una conexi√≥n m√°s estable que las conexiones inal√°mbricas, como el Wi-Fi, adem√°s de ser m√°s segura y econ√≥mica.
Conecta dispositivos: Ethernet se utiliza para conectar una amplia variedad de dispositivos, incluyendo computadoras, routers, consolas de videojuegos, televisores inteligentes y m√°s. Es la tecnolog√≠a m√°s com√∫n para conectar dispositivos dentro de una misma √°rea, como una oficina o un hogar.

English
An Ethernet connection is a technology that allows electronic devices to be connected to a local area network (LAN) or wide area network (WAN) via a cable. Its main function is to transmit data between devices, either to share information or to connect to the Internet.
In more detail:

Connects by cable: Ethernet uses cables, usually RJ45 cables, to establish communication between devices. There are different types of Ethernet cables, categorized by their transfer speed and network frequency. Ethernet offers faster speeds and a more stable connection than wireless connections, such as Wi-Fi, as well as being more secure and cost-effective.
Connects devices: Ethernet is used to connect a wide variety of devices, including computers, routers, video game consoles, smart TVs and more. It is the most common technology for connecting devices within the same area, such as an office or home.

Comparison with Wi-Fi: Although Wi-Fi is more convenient, Ethernet offers a better experience in terms of speed, stability and security.

In summary, the Ethernet connection is a fundamental technology for wired data networks, providing a reliable and efficient way to connect devices and share information.

es/glossary/conc-firewall.title: Cortafuegos | Firewall
es/glossary/conc-firewall.content:
Un firewall es un sistema de seguridad de red dise√±ado para monitorear y controlar el tr√°fico de red entrante y saliente, actuando como una barrera entre una red interna y redes externas, como Internet.¬†
Su funci√≥n principal es permitir o bloquear el tr√°fico bas√°ndose en un conjunto predefinido de reglas de seguridad, protegiendo as√≠ la red de accesos no autorizados y amenazas cibern√©ticas. (Fuente: Fortinet)
¬øC√≥mo funciona un firewall?

Aplicaci√≥n de reglas: Se basan en reglas predefinidas para determinar si el tr√°fico debe ser permitido, bloqueado o restringido. (Fuente: Fortinet)

Tipos de firewalls: Pueden ser de hardware o software, y algunos firewalls de √∫ltima generaci√≥n incorporan funciones adicionales como sistemas de detecci√≥n y prevenci√≥n de intrusiones, VPN, y an√°lisis de contenido profundo. (Fuente: Fortinet)

¬øPor qu√© es importante un firewall?

Prevenci√≥n de ataques: Act√∫a como una primera l√≠nea de defensa contra diversas amenazas cibern√©ticas, como malware, virus y ataques de phishing. (Fuente: Davantis)

English
A firewall is a network security system designed to monitor and control incoming and outgoing network traffic, acting as a barrier between an internal network and external networks, such as the Internet.

(Source: [Fortinet](www.fortinet.com/lat/resources/cyberglossary/firewall#:~:text=Un firewall es un dispositivo,y redes externas no confiables.))
How does a firewall work?

Rule enforcement: They rely on predefined rules to determine whether traffic should be allowed, blocked or restricted. (Source: www.fortinet.com/lat/resources/cyberglossary/firewall
Threat protection: They help prevent cyber attacks, such as malware, viruses, hacking attempts and unauthorized access to the network. (Source: www.hpe.com/lamerica/es/what-is/network-firewall.html
Types of firewalls: They can be hardware or software, and some state-of-the-art firewalls incorporate additional functions such as intrusion detection and prevention systems, VPN, and deep content analysis. (Source: www.fortinet.com/lat/resources/cyberglossary/hardware-firewalls-better-than-software

Why is a firewall important?

Access control: Allows network administrators to define access policies and restrict access to certain resources or websites. (Source: www.redestelecom.es/seguridad/que-es-un-firewall-o-cortafuegos-como-funciona-tipos-y-usos/
Attack prevention: Acts as a first line of defense against various cyber threats, such as malware, viruses and phishing attacks. (Source: www.davantis.com/es/blog/tecnologia/ciberseguridad/
Regulatory compliance: In many industries, the use of firewalls is a requirement to comply with security and privacy regulations. (Source: www.techtarget.com/searchsecurity/definition/firewall

In summary, a firewall is an essential tool for protecting networks and devices from cyber threats, ensuring that only authorized traffic can access the network.

es/glossary/conc-gprs.title: GPRS (Servicio General de Paquetes V√≠a Radio) | GPRS (General Packet Radio Services)
es/glossary/conc-gprs.content:
GPRS fue una tecnolog√≠a clave que introdujo el concepto de transferencia de datos por paquetes en las redes m√≥viles, sentando las bases para los servicios de datos m√≥viles que hoy damos por sentados, y sigue siendo √∫til en aplicaciones donde la transferencia de datos no requiere alta velocidad.

GPRS es un protocolo de comunicaci√≥n de datos que opera sobre las redes de telefon√≠a m√≥vil de segunda generaci√≥n (2G), actuando como una mejora de la tecnolog√≠a GSM.
En lugar de usar un canal dedicado y continuo para datos (como GSM), GPRS asigna los recursos de la red solo cuando se est√°n enviando datos, lo que la hace m√°s eficiente.

¬øPara qu√© sirve?

Acceso a Internet y Datos M√≥viles: Permiti√≥ a los usuarios conectarse a internet desde sus dispositivos m√≥viles, aunque con velocidades moderadas.
Mensajer√≠a Multimedia (MMS) y Correo Electr√≥nico: Facilit√≥ el env√≠o y recepci√≥n de mensajes m√°s complejos que los SMS.
Servicios de Localizaci√≥n: Se utiliz√≥ para proporcionar servicios de localizaci√≥n a trav√©s de la red m√≥vil.
Alarmas de Seguridad: GPRS sigue siendo relevante en sistemas de alarmas, ya que permite la transmisi√≥n segura de se√±ales de alarma sin depender de una l√≠nea telef√≥nica fija.

English
GPRS was a key technology that introduced the concept of packet data transfer in mobile networks, laying the groundwork for the mobile data services we take for granted today, and it remains useful in applications where data transfer doesn‚Äôt require high speed.

General Packet Radio Service: Means that information is divided into small data ‚Äúpackets,‚Äù which are sent independently through the network.
2G Technology: GPRS is a data communication protocol that operates over second-generation (2G) mobile telephone networks, acting as an enhancement to GSM technology.
Packet Switching: Instead of using a dedicated and continuous channel for data (like GSM), GPRS allocates network resources only when data is being sent, making it more efficient.

What is it used for?

Internet Access and Mobile Data: Allowed users to connect to the internet from their mobile devices, although at moderate speeds.
Multimedia Messaging (MMS) and Email: Facilitated the sending and receiving of more complex messages than SMS.
Location Services: Was used to provide location services through the mobile network.
Security Alarms: GPRS remains relevant in alarm systems, as it allows secure transmission of alarm signals without depending on a fixed telephone line.

es/glossary/conc-hostapd-daemon.title: Demonio Hostapd | Hostapd Daemon
es/glossary/conc-hostapd-daemon.content:
Hostapd¬†(host access point daemon) es un demonio de espacio de usuario que permite que una tarjeta de interfaz de red (NIC) funcione como un punto de acceso inal√°mbrico (AP) y un servidor de autenticaci√≥n.
En esencia, convierte tu computadora en un router Wi-Fi, permitiendo que otros dispositivos se conecten a internet a trav√©s de ella.
En m√°s detalle:

Punto de acceso (AP): Hostapd crea una red inal√°mbrica a la que otros dispositivos pueden conectarse, similar a un router tradicional.
Servidor de autenticaci√≥n: Gestiona la autenticaci√≥n de usuarios que intentan conectarse a la red, garantizando que solo los dispositivos autorizados puedan acceder.
IEEE 802.11: Hostapd implementa el protocolo IEEE 802.11, el est√°ndar para redes inal√°mbricas, que incluye funciones como gesti√≥n de puntos de acceso, autenticaci√≥n (WPA/WPA2) y acceso a redes protegidas.
Implementaciones: Existen varias implementaciones de hostapd, como la de Jouni Malinen (la m√°s com√∫n), OpenBSD y Devicescape.
Linux y FreeBSD: Hostapd es compatible con Linux (Host AP, madwifi y controladores basados en mac80211) y FreeBSD (net80211).
Uso com√∫n: Se utiliza principalmente en dispositivos como Raspberry Pi para crear puntos de acceso Wi-Fi y en sistemas de prueba de seguridad inal√°mbrica.

English
hostapd (host access point daemon) is a user-space daemon that allows a network interface card (NIC) to function as a wireless access point (AP) and an authentication server.
In essence, it turns your computer into a Wi-Fi router, allowing other devices to connect to the internet through it.
In more detail:

Access point (AP): Hostapd creates a wireless network that other devices can connect to, similar to a traditional router.
Authentication server: It manages the authentication of users attempting to connect to the network, ensuring that only authorized devices can access it.
IEEE 802.11: Hostapd implements the IEEE 802.11 protocol, the standard for wireless networks, which includes functions such as access point management, authentication (WPA/WPA2) and access to protected networks.
Implementations: There are several implementations of hostapd, such as Jouni Malinen‚Äôs (the most common), OpenBSD and Devicescape.
**Linux and FreeBSD:** Hostapd is compatible with Linux (Host AP, madwifi and mac80211-based drivers) and FreeBSD (net80211).
Common use: It is primarily used in devices such as Raspberry Pi to create Wi-Fi access points and in wireless security testing systems.

es/glossary/conc-hspa-technology.title: Tecnolog√≠a HSPA (Acceso de Paquetes de Alta Velocidad) | HSPA Technology
es/glossary/conc-hspa-technology.content:
Significa Acceso de Paquetes de Alta Velocidad (High-Speed Packet Access) y es una tecnolog√≠a de mejora para las redes m√≥viles 3G que aumenta la velocidad y eficiencia de la transferencia de datos, tanto de descarga (HSDPA) como de carga (HSUPA).¬†
Sirve para permitir que dispositivos m√≥viles accedan a internet a velocidades superiores a las redes 3G b√°sicas, facilitando el acceso a servicios de datos m√°s r√°pidos en tel√©fonos inteligentes y tabletas, especialmente en √°reas donde 4G o 5G no est√°n disponibles.
¬øQu√© es HSPA?

HSPA es una tecnolog√≠a de tercera generaci√≥n (3G) que mejora las redes¬†UMTS¬†y¬†WCDMA,¬†incorporando las tecnolog√≠as HSDPA para enlaces descendentes y HSUPA para enlaces ascendentes.
HSDPA (High-Speed Downlink Packet Access):¬†Mejora la velocidad de descarga de datos, permitiendo una navegaci√≥n m√°s r√°pida y el acceso a contenidos pesados.
HSUPA (High-Speed Uplink Packet Access):¬†Aumenta la velocidad de subida de datos, lo que facilita la carga de fotos, videos y otros archivos grandes a la red.

¬øPara qu√© sirve HSPA?

Mayor velocidad de datos: HSPA ofrece velocidades de datos considerablemente m√°s altas en comparaci√≥n con las redes 3G iniciales, haciendo posible una experiencia similar a las conexiones¬†DSL.
Mejora de la eficiencia de la red: Utiliza t√©cnicas como la modulaci√≥n avanzada y una mayor utilizaci√≥n del espectro para transmitir datos de manera m√°s eficiente.
Acceso a servicios de datos: Permite que los dispositivos m√≥viles accedan a servicios de datos de alta velocidad, como navegaci√≥n web, streaming de video y descargas de aplicaciones, de forma m√°s fluida.
Soporte para m√∫ltiples servicios simult√°neos: Con la tecnolog√≠a 3G y HSPA, los dispositivos m√≥viles pueden mantener llamadas de voz y servicios de datos al mismo tiempo.
Conexi√≥n en √°reas con poca cobertura: Aunque las redes 4G y 5G est√°n presentes, HSPA sigue siendo relevante y es crucial para mantener la conectividad en √°reas rurales o cuando la cobertura 4G es limitada o experimenta saturaci√≥n.

English
It means High-Speed Packet Access and is an enhancement technology for 3G mobile networks that increases the speed and efficiency of data transfer, both download (HSDPA) and upload (HSUPA).
It serves to allow mobile devices to access the internet at speeds higher than basic 3G networks, facilitating access to faster data services on smartphones and tablets, especially in areas where 4G or 5G are not available.
What is HSPA?

HSPA is a third-generation (3G) technology that enhances UMTS and WCDMA networks, incorporating HSDPA technologies for downlink and HSUPA for uplink.
HSDPA (High-Speed Downlink Packet Access): Improves data download speed, allowing faster browsing and access to heavy content.
HSUPA (High-Speed Uplink Packet Access): Increases data upload speed, facilitating the upload of photos, videos, and other large files to the network.

What is HSPA used for?

Higher data speeds: HSPA offers considerably higher data speeds compared to initial 3G networks, making possible an experience similar to DSL connections.
Improved network efficiency: It uses techniques such as advanced modulation and greater spectrum utilization to transmit data more efficiently.
Access to data services: Allows mobile devices to access high-speed data services, such as web browsing, video streaming, and application downloads, more smoothly.
Support for multiple simultaneous services: With 3G and HSPA technology, mobile devices can maintain voice calls and data services at the same time.
Connection in areas with poor coverage: Although 4G and 5G networks are present, HSPA remains relevant and is crucial for maintaining connectivity in rural areas or when 4G coverage is limited or experiences saturation.

es/glossary/conc-imei-code.title: C√≥digo IMEI | IMEI Code
es/glossary/conc-imei-code.content:
El IMEI es un c√≥digo √∫nico de 15 d√≠gitos que identifica a cada tel√©fono m√≥vil a nivel mundial.¬†Significa ‚ÄúInternational Mobile Equipment Identity‚Äù y sirve para identificar un dispositivo espec√≠fico, como un DNI para celulares, permitiendo que las operadoras puedan distinguirlo en sus redes. (Fuente: BBVA)


Identificaci√≥n √∫nica: El IMEI es un n√∫mero de serie √∫nico para cada tel√©fono, lo que permite distinguirlo de cualquier otro dispositivo. (Fuente: Enacom)


Informaci√≥n para la red: Las operadoras lo utilizan para identificar el dispositivo cuando se conecta a la red, permitiendo el rastreo, bloqueo y desbloqueo del tel√©fono. (Fuente:BBVA)


Seguridad y control: El IMEI se utiliza para reportar tel√©fonos robados o perdidos y as√≠ bloquearlos, evitando que se utilicen con otras tarjetas SIM. (Fuente:BBC)


¬øC√≥mo encontrarlo? Puedes encontrar el IMEI de tu tel√©fono marcando *#06# en el teclado o consult√°ndolo en la configuraci√≥n del dispositivo, en la caja original o debajo de la bater√≠a. (Fuente:T-Mobile)

English
The IMEI is a unique 15-digit code that identifies each cell phone worldwide. It stands for ‚ÄúInternational Mobile Equipment Identity‚Äù and is used to identify a specific device, like a DNI for cell phones, allowing operators to distinguish it in their networks (Source: [BBVA](www.bbva.com/es/codigo-imei-usarlo-cualquier-telefono-movil/#:~:text=Cualquier tel√©fono inteligente tiene una,adelante se mostrar√°n sus usos.)).

Unique identification: The IMEI is a unique serial number for each phone, allowing it to be distinguished from any other device (Source: www.enacom.gob.ar/imei.
Information for the network: Operators use it to identify the device when it connects to the network, allowing the tracking, locking and unlocking of the phone. (Source: www.bbva.com/es/codigo-imei-usarlo-cualquier-telefono-movil/
Security and control: The IMEI is used to report stolen or lost phones and thus block them, preventing them from being used with other SIM cards. (Source: www.bbc.com/mundo/noticias-42774859
How to find it? You can find your phone‚Äôs IMEI by dialing *#06# on the keypad or by looking it up in the device‚Äôs settings, on the original box or under the battery.https://es.t-mobile.com/dialed-in/wireless/what-is-an-imei-number
Utility: In addition to security, the IMEI can be useful for obtaining information about the device, such as model, make, and country of origin. (Source: 





- **Not the same as SIM:** Unlike the SIM card, which can be changed from phone to phone, the IMEI is a unique identifier of the device itself. (Source:

es/glossary/conc-information-system.title: Sistema inform√°tico (SI) | Information system (IS)
es/glossary/conc-information-system.content:
Entendemos por¬†sistema inform√°tico¬†el¬†conjunto de elementos f√≠sicos y l√≥gicos que se encargan de recibir, guardar y procesar datos para luego entregarlos en forma de resultados. El esquema de un sistema inform√°tico engloba todo aquello que contiene una parte tangible (hardware) y otra l√≥gica (software).
En la¬†actualidad, los SI¬†ocupan un lugar clave para la organizaci√≥n humana, ya que resulta ser una herramienta poderosa para el intercambio de informaci√≥n y la elaboraci√≥n de redes inform√°ticas que superan la barrera de las distancias.
Componentes¬†de un sistema inform√°tico
Los elementos que forman la¬†estructura b√°sica¬†de todo sistema inform√°tico son:

Hardware:¬†recoge todas las partes f√≠sicas del SI, es decir, todo lo que se puede tocar. En el caso de un ordenador, estos elementos del sistema inform√°tico ser√≠an: la pantalla, el teclado o el rat√≥n.
Software:¬†se refiere a la parte l√≥gica de todo sistema inform√°tico, lo intangible. Es el conjunto de programas incluyendo datos, instrucciones, aplicaciones, etc, que permiten al usuario comunicarse con el hardware para poder realizar diversas tareas.
Personal inform√°tico:¬†toda persona que utiliza de alguna manera el sistema, entre ellos, los creadores de software, los programadores o los usuarios en general.

Caracter√≠sticas de un sistema inform√°tico
Algunas¬†caracter√≠sticas¬†que definen a un SI son:

Los sistemas inform√°ticos est√°n¬†dise√±ados para procesar, almacenar, obtener y recibir informaci√≥n.
Proporcionan una interfaz amigable¬†para su uso y gesti√≥n por parte de las personas.
Facilitan la automatizaci√≥n de los procesos, ya que la programaci√≥n de un sistema inform√°tico est√° dirigida a realizar tareas de forma aut√≥noma.
Su¬†objetivo¬†primordial es¬†ofrecer nuevas y mejores condiciones de vida¬†a los seres humanos.

Clasificaci√≥n de los sistemas inform√°ticos
Los sistemas inform√°ticos pueden clasificarse seg√∫n su:

Volumen de procesamiento:¬†dependiendo de la capacidad que tienen para procesar y gestionar los datos.
Utilizaci√≥n:¬†es decir, el uso que se le da al sistema inform√°tico, ya sea para cumplir tareas con criterio reducido o para manejar un mayor n√∫mero de variables.
Funci√≥n:¬†seg√∫n si es dise√±ado para cumplir prop√≥sitos puntuales dentro de una serie de trabajos. Podr√≠a estar programado para dar sugerencias en la toma de decisiones o para tomar una decisi√≥n propia a partir de datos recolectados.
Agrupamiento:¬†seg√∫n sean sistemas aislados o formen parte de redes de equipos interconectados en redes privadas, locales, amplias, etc√©tera.

Una vez que comprendamos qu√© son los sistemas inform√°ticos, pasamos a nombrar algunas¬†aplicaciones pr√°cticas, es decir,¬†para qu√© sirve un sistema inform√°tico en el mundo real. (Fuente: Universidad Isabel I)
English
A computer system is understood as the set of physical and logical elements that are responsible for receiving, storing and processing data and then delivering them in the form of results. The scheme of a computer system encompasses everything that contains a tangible part (hardware) and a logical part (software).
Nowadays, IS occupy a key place in human organization, as it is a powerful tool for the exchange of information and the development of computer networks that overcome the barrier of distances.
Components of a computer system
The elements that form the basic structure of any computer system are:

Hardware: this includes all the physical parts of the IS, i.e. everything that can be touched. In the case of a computer, these elements of the computer system would be: the screen, the keyboard or the mouse.
Software: refers to the logical part of any computer system, the intangible part. It is the set of programs including data, instructions, applications, etc., that allow the user to communicate with the hardware in order to perform various tasks.
Computer personnel: any person who uses the system in some way, including software developers, programmers or users in general.

Features of a computer system
Some characteristics that define an IS are:

Computer systems are designed to process, store, obtain and receive information.
They provide a friendly interface for its use and management by people.
They facilitate the automation of processes, since the programming of a computer system is aimed at performing tasks autonomously.
Their primary objective is to offer new and better living conditions to human beings.

Classification of computer systems
Computer systems can be classified according to their:

Processing volume: depending on the capacity they have to process and manage data.
Utilization: that is, the use given to the computer system, either to fulfill tasks with reduced criteria or to handle a greater number of variables.
Function: depending on whether it is designed to fulfill specific purposes within a series of jobs. It could be programmed to give suggestions for decision making or to make its own decision based on collected data.
Grouping: depending on whether they are isolated systems or are part of networks of equipment interconnected in private, local, wide networks, etcetera.

Once we understand what computer systems are, we will go on to name some practical applications, i.e., what a computer system is used for in the real world. (Source: Isabel I University)

es/glossary/conc-interface.title: Interfaz | Interface
es/glossary/conc-interface.content:
En t√©rminos generales, una interfaz es un punto de contacto o conexi√≥n entre dos sistemas, componentes o entidades que permite la interacci√≥n y el intercambio de informaci√≥n entre ellos.¬†
Puede ser f√≠sica, como la conexi√≥n entre un teclado y una computadora, o l√≥gica, como la forma en que un programa se comunica con el sistema operativo.
Tipos de interfaces:

Interfaz de usuario (UI): Es la forma en que un usuario interact√∫a con un sistema, ya sea un programa, una p√°gina web o un dispositivo.¬†Incluye elementos visuales y funcionales que permiten al usuario realizar acciones y navegar por el sistema. (Fuente: Wikipedia)
Interfaz de programaci√≥n de aplicaciones (API): Define c√≥mo diferentes programas o componentes de software pueden comunicarse entre s√≠, permitiendo que se utilicen funciones y datos de otros programas. (Fuente: Microsoft)
Interfaz de red: Es el punto de conexi√≥n entre dispositivos en una red, como una tarjeta de interfaz de red (NIC) que conecta una computadora a una red. (Fuente: Microsoft)
Interfaz cerebro-computadora (BCI): Es una tecnolog√≠a innovadora que permite la comunicaci√≥n directa entre el cerebro y un dispositivo externo, como una pr√≥tesis. (Fuente: Wikipedia)

En resumen, una interfaz facilita la interacci√≥n y el intercambio de informaci√≥n entre diferentes partes, ya sean f√≠sicas, l√≥gicas o conceptuales.
Interfaz inal√°mbrica
Una interfaz inal√°mbrica es un mecanismo que permite la comunicaci√≥n entre dispositivos electr√≥nicos sin necesidad de cables f√≠sicos, utilizando ondas de radio u otras tecnolog√≠as inal√°mbricas.¬†Permite la conexi√≥n a redes inform√°ticas, como Wi-Fi, o la comunicaci√≥n entre dispositivos cercanos, como Bluetooth.
M√°s detalladamente:

Comunicaci√≥n sin cables: A diferencia de las interfaces cableadas, que requieren conexiones f√≠sicas como cables Ethernet o USB, las interfaces inal√°mbricas utilizan ondas de radio u otras tecnolog√≠as para transmitir datos. (Fuente: Mastervolt)
Tipos comunes: Los ejemplos m√°s comunes de interfaces inal√°mbricas incluyen Wi-Fi (IEEE 802.11), Bluetooth y NFC. (Fuente: Fibermall)
Funcionamiento: Estas interfaces suelen estar integradas en tarjetas de red inal√°mbricas (WNIC) o adaptadores, que se conectan a los dispositivos y permiten la comunicaci√≥n con otros dispositivos o redes a trav√©s de ondas de radio. (Fuente: Quora)
Aplicaciones: Las interfaces inal√°mbricas son fundamentales para la conectividad de dispositivos m√≥viles, como computadoras port√°tiles, tel√©fonos inteligentes y tabletas, y para la creaci√≥n de redes de √°rea local inal√°mbricas (WLAN o Wi-Fi). (Fuente: Cisco)
Seguridad: Las interfaces inal√°mbricas suelen incluir mecanismos de seguridad, como WPA3, para proteger la informaci√≥n transmitida. (Fuente: Fibermall)
Modos de operaci√≥n: Algunas tarjetas de red inal√°mbricas pueden funcionar como puntos de acceso (AP) para que otros dispositivos se conecten, o como clientes que acceden a una red a trav√©s de un punto de acceso. (Fuente: Vyos)

English
In general terms, an interface is a point of contact or connection between two systems, components or entities that allows interaction and information exchange between them.
It can be physical, such as the connection between a keyboard and a computer, or logical, such as the way a program communicates with the operating system.
Types of interfaces:

User interface (UI): the way a user interacts with a system, whether it is a program, a web page or a device. It includes visual and functional elements that allow the user to perform actions and navigate the system (Source: es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interfaz_de_usuario.
Application Programming Interface (API): Defines how different programs or software components can communicate with each other, allowing functions and data from other programs to be used. (Source: learn.microsoft.com/es-es/windows/win32/rpc/defining-the-interface
Network interface: The connection point between devices on a network, such as a network interface card (NIC) that connects a computer to a network. (Source: learn.microsoft.com/es-es/windows/win32/network-interfaces
Brain-computer interface (BCI): An innovative technology that enables direct communication between the brain and an external device, such as a prosthesis. (Source: es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interfaz_gr%C3%A1fica_de_usuario

In short, an interface facilitates the interaction and exchange of information between different parts, whether physical, logical or conceptual.
Wireless interface
A wireless interface is a mechanism that enables communication between electronic devices without the need for physical cables, using radio waves or other wireless technologies. It allows connection to computer networks, such as Wi-Fi, or communication between nearby devices, such as Bluetooth.
In more detail:

Wireless communication: Unlike wired interfaces, which require physical connections such as Ethernet or USB cables, wireless interfaces use radio waves or other technologies to transmit data. (Source: www.mastervolt.es/productos/interfaces-de-red/interfaz-inalmbrica1/
Common types: The most common examples of wireless interfaces include Wi-Fi (IEEE 802.11), Bluetooth and NFC. (Source: www.fibermall.com/es/blog/network-interface-meaning.htm
Operation: These interfaces are typically embedded in wireless network cards (WNICs) or adapters, which connect to devices and enable communication with other devices or networks via radio waves. (Source: www.quora.com/What-is-a-wireless-network-interface-card-used-for
Applications: Wireless interfaces are essential for connectivity of mobile devices, such as laptops, smartphones and tablets, and for the creation of wireless local area networks (WLANs or Wi-Fi). (Source: www.cisco.com/c/es_mx/solutions/small-business/resource-center/networking/wireless-network.html
Security: Wireless interfaces often include security mechanisms, such as WPA3, to protect transmitted information. (Source: www.fibermall.com/es/blog/network-interface-meaning.htm
Modes of operation: Some wireless network cards can function as access points (APs) for other devices to connect to, or as clients accessing a network through an access point. (Source: docs.vyos.io/en/1.3/configuration/interfaces/wireless.html

es/glossary/conc-ip-address.title: Direcci√≥n IP | IP Address
es/glossary/conc-ip-address.content:
Una direcci√≥n IP es un identificador √∫nico asignado a cada dispositivo conectado a una red que utiliza el protocolo de Internet.¬†
En esencia, es como una direcci√≥n postal para tu dispositivo en el mundo digital, permitiendo que otros dispositivos te encuentren y se comuniquen contigo a trav√©s de Internet o una red local (Fuente: Fortinet)
M√°s detalladamente:

Identificaci√≥n √∫nica: Cada dispositivo conectado a una red, ya sea una computadora, tel√©fono, impresora, etc., tiene una direcci√≥n IP √∫nica que lo identifica de manera inequ√≠voca dentro de esa red.
Comunicaci√≥n: Las direcciones IP son fundamentales para que los dispositivos puedan enviar y recibir datos entre s√≠.¬†Sin ellas, no podr√≠an encontrarse ni intercambiar informaci√≥n.
Dos versiones: Existen dos versiones principales de direcciones IP: IPv4 e IPv6.¬†IPv4 es la versi√≥n m√°s antigua y utiliza n√∫meros de 32 bits, mientras que IPv6 es m√°s reciente y utiliza n√∫meros de 128 bits, lo que permite un n√∫mero mucho mayor de direcciones posibles.
Tipos de direcciones: Adem√°s de la versi√≥n, las direcciones IP pueden ser p√∫blicas (visibles en Internet) o privadas (utilizadas dentro de una red local).¬†Tambi√©n pueden ser est√°ticas (permanentes) o din√°micas (cambian con el tiempo).
Funcionamiento: Cuando visitas un sitio web, tu dispositivo env√≠a una solicitud a trav√©s de tu proveedor de servicios de Internet (ISP) utilizando tu direcci√≥n IP.¬†El ISP localiza el sitio web y te env√≠a la informaci√≥n de vuelta, utilizando tu direcci√≥n IP como destino.

English
An IP address is a unique identifier assigned to each device connected to a network using Internet Protocol.
In essence, it is like a postal address for your device in the digital world, allowing other devices to find and communicate with you over the Internet or a local network (source [Fortinet](www.fortinet.com/lat/resources/cyberglossary/what-is-ip-address#:~:text=Definici√≥n y explicaci√≥n de la direcci√≥n IP&text=Una definici√≥n de direcci√≥n IP,redes se comuniquen entre s√≠.)).
In more detail:

Unique identification: Each device connected to a network, be it a computer, phone, printer, etc., has a unique IP address that uniquely identifies it within that network.
Communication: IP addresses are essential for devices to be able to send and receive data to and from each other. Without them, they would not be able to find each other or exchange information.
Two versions: There are two main versions of IP addresses: IPv4 and IPv6. IPv4 is the older version and uses 32-bit numbers, while IPv6 is newer and uses 128-bit numbers, allowing for a much larger number of possible addresses.
Types of addresses: In addition to version, IP addresses can be public (visible on the Internet) or private (used within a local network). They can also be static (permanent) or dynamic (change over time).
How it works: When you visit a website, your device sends a request through your Internet Service Provider (ISP) using your IP address. The ISP locates the website and sends the information back to you, using your IP address as the destination.

es/glossary/conc-latency.title: Latencia | Latency
es/glossary/conc-latency.content:

Para calcular la latencia se utilizan dos par√°metros: el¬†ping, una unidad de medida que se expresa en milisegundos (ms)., y el lag, que se refiere al retardo excesivo.
Puedes medir ambos par√°metros con un test de velocidad
¬øQu√© es el ping?

En t√©rminos simples, la latencia es el tiempo que tarda en transmitirse un paquete de datos dentro de la red. Es decir, es el tiempo exacto que pasa desde que tu dispositivo hizo una solicitud al servidor y el tiempo que tardas en recibir una respuesta desde el servidor.
Por otro lado,¬†el ping es la medida que se ocupa para medir la latencia y es expresado en milisegundos (o en su abreviaci√≥n ms).¬†Esto significa que a medida que el ping sea m√°s bajo, mejor. Lo m√°s recomendable es que el ping se encuentre por debajo de los 100 ms, a partir de los 65 ms la conexi√≥n es suficiente y no tendr√≠as que sufrir ning√∫n inconveniente para hacer una videollamada. ¬øQu√© es el lag?
El lag se refiere al retardo excesivo que puede ser producido por una telecomunicaci√≥n en tiempo real. Puede ser tu ordenador o la conexi√≥n de Internet.
El lag se produce seg√∫n el formato en el que se presente. Por ejemplo, en los videos la imagen suele empeorar, tu m√∫sica puede que tenga un sonido con interferencias y el cl√°sico en videojuegos online, la demora en que tu personaje realice tus comandos.
English
Latency is the exact time it takes for a data packet to be transmitted over a network.
It is the time that elapses between the time your browser makes a request for information and the time it takes for the requested response to arrive.
The lower the latency, the better the Internet connection.
Two parameters are used to calculate latency: ping, a unit of measurement expressed in milliseconds (ms), and lag, which refers to excessive delay.
You can measure both parameters with a speed test
What is ping?
Ping is a unit of measurement used to measure latency. Before we continue, do you know what latency is? In simple terms, latency is the time it takes for a data packet to be transmitted within the network. That is, it is the exact time that passes since your device made a request to the server and the time it takes to receive a response from the server.
On the other hand, ping is the measure of latency and is expressed in milliseconds (or in its abbreviation ms). This means that the lower the ping, the better. The most advisable is that the ping is below 100 ms, from 65 ms the connection is sufficient and you should not have to suffer any inconvenience to make a video call. In case you are a gamer, the optimal ping will be around 20 ms so that you do not have so much delay or lag.
What is lag?
Lag refers to the excessive delay that can be produced by a real-time telecommunication. Its causes can be related to a high latency in the network or because there is not enough processing power in the service or client with which the communication is established. It can be your computer or Internet connection.
The lag occurs depending on the format in which it is presented. For example, in videos the image tends to worsen, your music may have a sound with interference and the classic in online video games, the delay in your character to perform your commands.

es/glossary/conc-lte-4g-connection.title: Conexi√≥n 4G o LTE | LTE or 4G Connection
es/glossary/conc-lte-4g-connection.content:

¬øPara qu√© sirve LTE?

English
LTE, which stands for Long Term Evolution, is a global wireless communication standard that provides fourth-generation (4G) mobile network technology, offering much faster data transfer speeds and reduced latency compared to the previous generation (3G). Its main function is to enable high-speed internet access on mobile devices, enabling services such as video streaming, rapid content downloading, and IoT (Internet of Things) applications.
What is LTE used for?

Web browsing and content streaming: Allows downloading websites, videos, and music more quickly and smoothly.
High-quality calls: Voice over LTE (VoLTE) technology enables voice calls through the LTE data network, improving sound quality and reducing call setup time.
Improved communication on mobile devices: Facilitates sending instant messages and video communication more efficiently.
Expansion of IoT applications: LTE is fundamental for connecting a large number of devices, such as smartwatches, sensors, and automation systems, to the internet network.
Teleworking and remote work: Allows video conferencing and access to cloud platforms with greater stability and speed, making it possible to work from anywhere.

es/glossary/conc-operating-system.title: Sistema operativo (SO) | Operating system (OS)
es/glossary/conc-operating-system.content:

English
An operating system (OS) is a fundamental piece of software that acts as an intermediary between the hardware of a device (such as a computer or phone) and the applications you use.
It manages system resources, such as memory, processor, and input/output devices, and allows applications to run and function properly. Without an OS, it would be very difficult or impossible to use a computing device.
Main functions of an operating system:

Resource management: the OS manages RAM, storage space, processor, input/output devices (keyboard, mouse, display, etc.) and other hardware resources.
User interface: Allows interaction with the user through graphical interfaces (windows, icons) or command lines.
Application execution: The OS loads and executes applications, providing them with the necessary resources and managing their interaction with the hardware.
Process management: Organizes and controls the execution of multiple tasks or processes simultaneously (multitasking).
File system: Organizes, stores and retrieves files on storage devices.
Security: Controls access to system resources, protecting it from unauthorized access.
Network communication: Enables communication between devices over networks, such as the Internet.

Examples of operating systems:

For computers: Windows, macOS, Linux.
For mobile devices: Android, iOS.

In short, an operating system is essential for any computing device to function properly, allowing users to interact with the hardware and run applications efficiently.

es/glossary/conc-ping-program.title: Programa ping | Ping program
es/glossary/conc-ping-program.content:

En esencia, ping env√≠a un paquete de datos a un dispositivo de destino y mide el tiempo que tarda en recibir la respuesta.¬†Este tiempo, medido en milisegundos, se conoce como latencia o ping, y sirve para evaluar la calidad de la conexi√≥n.
¬øC√≥mo funciona?

El dispositivo de destino, si est√° en l√≠nea, responde con un paquete de eco ICMP.

English
The ping program is a network diagnostic tool used to verify connectivity and latency between two devices.
In essence, ping sends a data packet to a target device and measures the time it takes to receive the response. This time, measured in milliseconds, is known as latency or ping, and is used to assess the quality of the connection.
How does it work?

The ping command sends an ICMP (Internet Control Message Protocol) packet to the destination device.
The target device, if it is online, responds with an ICMP echo packet.
The ping tool measures the time it takes for the response to arrive and displays it as ‚Äúround-trip time‚Äù (RTT) in milliseconds.
In addition, ping can indicate if there is packet loss, which means that some packets did not reach their destination.

What is it used for?

Verify connectivity: Ensure that a device is connected and responding on the network.
Measure latency: Determine the quality of the connection, especially in online gaming and video conferencing.
Diagnose network problems: Identify connectivity problems, packet loss or high latency.

In short, ping is an essential tool to diagnose and evaluate the quality of the network connection between two devices.

RAM memory is the computer‚Äôs working memory, where data and programs being actively used are stored to allow quick and efficient access by the processor.

To charge a Raspberry Pi, you need to connect it to a power supply.
The most common way is through a USB to microUSB or USB-C cable, depending on the model, connected to a USB power adapter. Make sure that the adapter provides the right voltage and current for your Raspberry Pi model.
Steps:

Identify the power connector: Older models, such as the Raspberry Pi 3 and earlier, use a microUSB port, while newer models, such as the Raspberry Pi 4 and 5, use USB-C.
Connect the power adapter: Connect the USB power adapter to the wall socket and then connect the corresponding USB cable to the Raspberry Pi port.
Check the power: If everything is connected correctly, the Raspberry Pi should turn on. Some models have indicator lights that will help you confirm power.

Keep in mind:

Voltage and current: The Raspberry Pi requires a 5V power supply. The current required can vary by model, but generally 2.5A to 3A is recommended for models such as the Raspberry Pi 4, according to bret.dk.
Phone chargers: While some phone chargers may work, it is recommended to use a power adapter designed specifically for the Raspberry Pi to ensure optimal performance and avoid power issues.
USB hubs: If you need to connect multiple USB devices to the Raspberry Pi, consider using an externally powered USB hub to avoid power supply issues.
Batteries: If you need to power the Raspberry Pi with a battery, be sure to use a DC/DC converter to boost the battery voltage to 5V.
Raspberry Pi Pico: The Raspberry Pi Pico can be powered by an external battery connected via a microUSB to USB cable.

es/glossary/conc-rg6-cable.title: Cable RG6 | RG6 Cable

English

Shielding: RG6 cable has a shielding layer to protect the signal from electromagnetic interference (EMI) and noise. It can be single, double (foil and braid) or quadruple.
Impedance: Typically 75 ohms, which is the standard impedance for most video and television applications.
Applications: Used to connect antennas, cable set-top boxes, satellite dishes, and to carry internet and television signals.
Advantages: It offers better signal quality and lower signal loss than other coaxial cables such as RG59, especially in high frequency and long distance applications.

In summary, RG6 cable is a versatile, high performance coaxial cable, ideal for transmitting video and data signals over different media and distances.

En esencia, un servidor es un ordenador potente que est√° dise√±ado para manejar grandes cantidades de datos y realizar tareas complejas de manera eficiente para m√∫ltiples usuarios simult√°neamente.¬†

English
A server is a type of computer or computer system designed to provide services, resources or information to other devices or users over a network.
It functions as an intermediary that processes requests and sends them to other computers, or to individual users. These services may include file storage, database management, website hosting, among others.
In essence, a server is a powerful computer that is designed to handle large amounts of data and perform complex tasks efficiently for multiple users simultaneously.
Some common examples of servers include:

Web servers: They store and serve web pages.
Mail servers: They manage the sending and receiving of e-mail messages.
Database servers: Store and manage large data sets.
File servers: Allow storage and shared access to files.
Application servers: Run applications for multiple users.

According to the purpose, we can classify them into:

Test servers: A test server, also known as a staging or pre-production server, is a standalone environment used to test and validate applications or websites prior to their deployment on a production server (the one used by end users). Servers are a fundamental part of the Internet infrastructure and enterprise networks, as they enable communication and information exchange between different devices and users.

es/glossary/conc-simcard.title: Tarjeta SIM | SIM Card

A SIM card, or Subscriber Identity Module, is a small, removable card that is inserted into cell phones and other devices to identify them on a cellular network and allow them to access services such as calls, messages and data.

es/glossary/conc-ssh-protocol.title: Protocolo SSH | SSH Protocol
es/glossary/conc-ssh-protocol.content:

Se utiliza principalmente para la administraci√≥n remota de sistemas y la transferencia segura de archivos.¬†En esencia, SSH crea un ‚Äút√∫nel‚Äù cifrado entre dos ordenadores, permitiendo la comunicaci√≥n protegida de datos, contrase√±as y otras informaciones sensibles (Fuente: Cloudflare)
M√°s detalles:

Acceso seguro: SSH proporciona una forma segura de acceder a servidores remotos, como el servidor de tu sitio web, desde tu computadora.
Autenticaci√≥n: Para establecer la conexi√≥n, SSH requiere autenticaci√≥n, que puede realizarse mediante nombre de usuario y contrase√±a, o mediante claves criptogr√°ficas p√∫blicas y privadas.
